article.headline: South Carolina St 80, Jacksonville St. 72
article.story: MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Brian Mason scored 24 points and Thurman Zimmerman added 18 Monday to lead South Carolina State to an 80-72 victory over Jacksonville State in the second round of the Black Coaches Association Classic. The Bulldogs evened their record at 1-1 in the consolation bracket for teams that lost first-round games Sunday. Walker Russell scored 19 points and B.J. Spencer had 13 for the Gamecocks (0-2). A basket by Brandon Davis early in the second half cut South Carolina State's lead to 42-40. But Dwight Dean, who had 13 points, scored two baskets in a 10-3 run that put the Bulldogs ahead 52-43 with 12:08 left to play. The Gamecocks never got that close again the rest of the way. South Carolina State led at the half 36-31. After Spencer tied the game for the third time at 27-all with a 3-pointer, the Bulldogs scored six straight points to go ahead 33-27. Zimmerman had a pair of free throws with 2:42 left to play and Dean then hit two baskets in the run.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
